00032 // This file contains mfuncs defined for struct rvalue (see expr.h) that
00033 // *cannot* be included in that struct's declaration because their
00034 // definitions must follow *both* rvalue's and func_rvalue's declarations.
00035 // jhrg 3/4/96
00036 
00037 #include "config_dap.h"
00038 
00039 static char rcsid[] not_used = {"$Id$"};

00050 using namespace std;
00051 
00052 rvalue::rvalue(BaseType *bt): value(bt), func(0), args(0)
00053 {
00054 }
00055 
00056 rvalue::rvalue(btp_func f, vector<rvalue *> *a) : value(0), func(f), args(a)
00057 {
00058 }
00059 
00060 rvalue::rvalue(): value(0), func(0), args(0)
00061 {
00062 }
00063 
00064 rvalue::~rvalue() 
00065 {
00066     // Deleting the BaseType pointers in value and args is a bad idea since
00067     // those might be variables in the dataset. The DDS dtor will take care
00068     // of deleting them. The constants wrapped in BaseType objects should be
00069     // pushed on the list of CE-allocated temp objects which the DDS also
00070     // frees. 
00071 }
00072 
00073 string
00074 rvalue::value_name()
00075 {
00076     assert(value);
00077 
00078     return value->name();
00079 }
00080 
00081 // Return the BaseType * to a value for an rvalue.
00082 // NB: this must be defined after the struct func_rvalue (since it uses
00083 // func_rvalue's bvalue() mfunc. 
00084 
00098 BaseType *
00099 rvalue::bvalue(const string &dataset, DDS &dds) 
00100 {
00101     if (value) {
00102     if (!value->read_p())
00103         value->read(dataset);
00104 
00105     return value;
00106     }
00107     else if (func) {
00108     int argc = args->size();
00109     // Add space for null terminator
00110 #ifdef WIN32
00111     BaseType **argv = (new (BaseType*)) + argc + 1;
00112 #else
00113     BaseType **argv = new (BaseType*)[argc + 1];
00114 #endif
00115 
00116     int index = 0;
00117     for (Args_iter i = args->begin(); i != args->end(); i++)
00118     {
00119         assert(*i) ;
00120         argv[index++] = (*i)->bvalue(dataset, dds);
00121     }
00122 
00123     argv[index] = 0;        // Add null terminator
00124     BaseType *ret_val = (*func)(argc, argv, dds);
00125 
00126 #ifdef WIN32
00127     delete *argv;       // Hmmm... 02/03/04 jhrg
00128 #else
00129     delete[] argv;
00130 #endif
00131 
00132     return ret_val;
00133     }
00134     else {
00135     return 0;
00136     }
00137 }
00138 
00139 
00147 BaseType **
00148 build_btp_args(rvalue_list *args, DDS &dds)
00149 {
00150     int argc = 0;
00151 
00152     if (args)
00153     argc = args->size();
00154 
00155     // Add space for a null terminator
00156     BaseType **argv = new (BaseType *[argc + 1]);
00157 
00158     string dataset = dds.filename();
00159         
00160     int index = 0;
00161     if (argc) {
00162     for (rvalue::Args_iter i = args->begin(); i != args->end(); i++) {
00163         argv[index++] = (*i)->bvalue(dataset, dds);
00164     }
00165     }
00166 
00167     argv[index] = 0;        // Add the null terminator.
00168 
00169     return argv;
00170 }

00173 // Revision 1.12.2.3  2004/02/04 00:05:11  jimg
00174 // Memory errors: I've fixed a number of memory errors (leaks, references)
00175 // found using valgrind. Many remain. I need to come up with a systematic
00176 // way of running the tests under valgrind.
00177 //
00178 // Revision 1.12.2.2  2003/09/06 23:10:40  jimg
00179 // Fixed a bug in rvalue::bvalue() where the send_p property was being set and
00180 // reset before and after the call to read() inside the if(value) statement.
00181 // These calls where a fix to a design flaw in BaseType. I fixed the problem in
00182 // BaseType by adding the in_selection property. This is used to tell read()
00183 // methods that a variable is in the current selection and should be read even
00184 // if it is not in the current projection. See bug 657.
00185 //
00186 // Revision 1.12.2.1  2003/08/30 09:58:36  rmorris

00188 // to be something compatible with both VC++ and gnu compilers.
00189 // See build_btp_args().  Fixes several expr-testsuite failures under
00190 // win32.

00197 // with [] in VC++.
00198 //
00199 // Revision 1.10.2.2  2003/04/18 03:29:03  jimg
00200 // Added set/reset of the send_p flag when a variable is read in the bvalue()
00201 // method. If this is not done then all the parts of a constructor type (like
00202 // Grid) won't be read (e.g., the Grid's map vectors are not read). I reset
00203 // send_p after reading in case the variable is an argument to a function and
00204 // not part of the current projection. That's pretty unlikely, but possible.

00245 // Revision 1.6  2000/09/21 16:22:08  jimg
00246 // Merged changes from Jose Garcia that add exceptions to the software.
00247 // Many methods that returned error codes now throw exectptions. There are
00248 // two classes which are thrown by the software, Error and InternalErr.
00249 // InternalErr is used to report errors within the library or errors using
00250 // the library. Error is used to reprot all other errors. Since InternalErr
00251 // is a subclass of Error, programs need only to catch Error.
